Class I18n

java.lang.Object
  I18n

public class I18n
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides some support for Internationalization, making it possible to easily get a String corresponding to a key in a properties file, using the method I18n.tr(). A method is also provided to change the locale.

Field Detail

propertyFileName

private static final java.lang.String propertyFileName
The base name for the properties files for this program. The default properties file name is strings.properties in the directory edu/hws/eck/mdb. Property files for other locales would have the form strings_xx.properties where xx is the code for the locale. To use this file in another program, only the propertyFileName has to be changed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

locale

private static java.util.Locale locale
If locale is null, the default locale is used. A non-null value can be set by calling setLocale() or setLocaleName() to use a non-default locale.

translations

private static java.util.ResourceBundle translations
The resource bundle that is created from the properties file.

Constructor Detail

I18n

private I18n()
Declaring a private constructor makes sure that no one will be able to create instances of this class. Everything in this class is static, so there is no reason to create an I18n object.

Method Detail

tr

public static java.lang.String tr(java.lang.String key,
                                  java.lang.Object... args)
Look up a key string in the properties file to find its translation. If no translation is found or any other error occurs, the key string is returned unmodified.

Parameters:
key - the key string.
args - if the value string associated with the key contains placeholders {0}, {1}, {2}, ..., then the values of the optional args parameters are substituted for the placeholders.
Returns:
the value associated to key in the properties files, with placeholders replaced by args if appropriate; if any error occurs, the key string is returned.

trIfFound

public static java.lang.String trIfFound(java.lang.String key,
                                         java.lang.Object... args)
Same as tr(), except that when an error occurs, the return value is null.

setLocale

public static void setLocale(java.util.Locale newLocale)
Specifies a locale to use for translations in future calls to I18n.tr(). (This does not, of course, affect any strings that have already been translated already.)

Parameters:
newLocale - the locale to use, or null to use the default locale

setLanguage

public static void setLanguage(java.lang.String localeLanguageCode)
Convenince mthod calls setLocale(new Locale(localeLanguageCode)). This would be used, for example, as I18n.setLanguage("fr");

Parameters:
localeLanguageCode - the two-letter language code for the locale

loadStrings

private static void loadStrings()
Used for loading the resource bundle. If it can't be loaded, then the bundle will be null after this method returns.
